selected_quotes: How should we record the sporting participation level of patients following ACL injury: how about online?

citation.abstract: The current methods measuring sports activity after anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury are commonly restricted to the most knee-demanding sports, and do not consider participation in multiple sports. We therefore developed an online activity survey to prospectively record the monthly participation in all major sports relevant to our patient-group.
citation.publisher: BMJ Publishing Group Ltd and British Association of Sport and Exercise Medicine
citation.title: Online registration of monthly sports participation after anterior cruciate ligament injury: a reliability and validity study

facebook.title: Online registration of monthly sports participation after anterior cruciate ligament injury: a relia
facebook.summary: New paper from NAR on the reliability and validity of a new method of monitoring sports participation in ACL-injured patients. A good and easy-to-use method that offers far more details on development of participation in different sports than commonly used

author.name: Norwegian Research Center for Active Rehabilitation
